column5: http://www.gi.alaska.edu/AuroraForec...ica/2012/07/14 Just a heads up to those up north that it might be worth staying up late the next two nights to watch aurora activity. The forecast predicts "extreme" activity starting tonight. "A significant event located on the Sun facing Earth took place on July 12. The effects of this event will begin to reach Earth early on the 14th of July GMT." Enjoy the show!
